channel.title: Leon Barnard's Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content on Leon Barnard's Portfolio

item.title: Setup and Configuration Redesign
item.description: A redesign of the setup and configuration interface for a physical therapy product as a UX team of one.

item.title: UI Design for Infection Prevention
item.description: A series of UI design projects to provide needed capabilities to hospital Infection Prevention specialists.

item.title: Agile User Stories and Design Specifications
item.description: Research, writing, and design for user stories and design specifications.

item.title: Live Wireframing Sessions
item.description: One-on-one online design consultations to help do-gooders bring their ideas to life.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of Wireframes
item.description: Product experts Ellen Chisa and Leon Barnard join Melissa Perri to discuss the importance of wireframing in product development.

item.title: Behind the Wireframes: Crafting SaaS Success with UX Expertise
item.description: Valuable insights into the world of wireframing and its role in the design and development process.

item.title: Leon Barnard 'Wireframing for Everyone'
item.description: A conversation about the approach and mindset of wireframing, and how it unlocks blockers within teams.

item.title: Design Faster and More Effectively With Wireframing
item.description: Tracy Osborn interviews Leon Barnard from Balsamiq about wireframing and design.

item.title: Find A Job For Long-Term Remote Work Success
item.description: Insights from 10 years of working fully-remote on how to build a sustainable remote career.

item.title: Wireframing 101 for SaaS Startups – with Leon Barnard
item.description: How to craft effective wireframes, dodge common pitfalls, and design great SaaS products.

item.title: UI Breakfast Podcast. Episode 271: Wireframing for Everyone
item.description: Learn about the journey of writing the book, and the different phases and types of wireframing,

item.title: Wireframing for Everyone
item.description: Wireframing for Everyone demystifies UI design through wireframes, by stripping away the decorative layer so that anyone can learn to construct a digital product and make it easy to use. Get it free.

item.title: Meet the Book: Wireframing for Everyone by Michael Angeles, Leon Barnard, and Billy Carlson
item.description: A peek into the book with our Meet the Book Q&A series. Learn what inspired the most important ideas of the book, how the three authors collaborated, and who should read this book.

item.title: Common Website Mistakes and How to Fix Them
item.description: Learn how to improve your website’s user experience! For each mistake you’ll learn what usually happens and why, what it looks like, and what to do about it.

item.title: The Antidote To UX Burnout is Designing For Users Who Need it Most
item.description: User experience design remains a highly-coveted and relatively satisfying profession. But I’ve started to see a noticeable trend in feelings of burnout and frustration in our field.

item.title: Life's Too Short for Bad Software (with Leon Barnard)
item.description: Learn how Balsamiq’s approach to marketing was conceived, and why the focus has always been to support the growth and development of product design as a discipline.

item.title: Considerations for Using Markdown Writing Apps on Static Sites
item.description: If you use a static site generator, you might find yourself writing a lot of Markdown. And the more you write it, the more you want the tooling experience to fade so the content takes focus.

item.title: Get Developers on Your Side by Making Their Job Easier
item.description: If you’ve never worked in the software industry before, learning the culture can be a huge part of your first year on the job.

item.title: UX as a Career Path for Recent Graduates
item.description: summary

item.title: Leon Barnard of Balsamiq: "You need to be OK with not knowing what everyone is working on"
item.description: Balsamiq is a leading wireframing tool, which has been on the market for over a decade. The team behind that company consists of over 30 people, working from the US and Europe. Today, we are talking to Leon Barnard, lead of the education team, about his role at Balsamiq and his experience with remote work in the last decade.

item.title: Five Steps to Creating Great Wireframes
item.description: Good wireframes solve real problems and lead to strong products. From writing out the scenario to gathering inputs, here is a proven path to a great website or app.

item.title: Wireframes Aren’t Just for Designers
item.description: Leon Barnard explains how wireframes can be invaluable in facilitating communication and knowledge transfer during the product development process.

item.title: Why Wireframes are Still Relevant
item.description: Why you should wireframe, what’s the right level of detail, where prototypes and sketches fit in, and how to make them a great communication tool for non-designers.

item.title: How to Start a Wireframe Project
item.description: Four techniques to start a wireframe project from scratch and ensure that you dedicate enough time to the ideation phase, where the success of your product begins.

item.title: 5 UX Designers Share Lessons Learned
How to Use Wireframes with Design Systems
item.description: An alternative to pushing wireframes beyond their limits is to keep them low fidelity and let another tool do the work of specifying the look and feel.

item.title: UI vs. UX: A Culinary Comparison
item.description: This article will combine storytelling with analogy to approach the subject of explaining UX differently.

item.title: What is UI Design?
item.description: Learn to see like a UI designer by deconstructing an interface into its 4 layers: controls, patterns, design principles, and templates.

item.title: Lightning Talk: "UX Design in the Real World"
"Why Markdown?" Presentation
item.description: All the resources and files I've used for my presentations about Markdown - leon-barnard/all-things-markdown

item.title: Hugo Templates for WordPress Designers
item.description: Dive into the basics of the popular static site generator called Hugo by comparing it to its most well-known "dynamic" ancestor, WordPress.

item.title: Balsamiq Docs Case Study, Part 3: Lists Get a Makeover
item.description: Give list pages a makeover using Hugo, a static site generator, with source files on GitHub from Leon Barnard, Designer and Writer at Balsamiq.

item.title: Balsamiq Docs Case Study, Part 2: Animated GIFs Pause and Play
item.description: Learn how to play and pause animated GIFs on static sites such as Hugo on GitHub from Leon Barnard, Designer and Writer at Balsamiq.

item.title: Balsamiq Docs Case Study, Part 1: Multiple Product Versions
item.description: Learn useful techniques for static sites such as Hugo on GitHub from Leon Barnard, Designer and Writer at Balsamiq. He describes documenting multiple versions of a product with a Go-coded solution.

item.title: Wireframing for Beginners
item.description: Wireframing is an essential skill for UX Designers and other experience design participants. Learn how to get your wireframing off to the right start.

item.title: From the Classroom to the Cubicle: UX in the Real World
item.description: When you arrive at your first UX job you'll find conditions a little different than they were in the classroom.

item.title: Getting Started with Static Sites
item.description: You may have heard the buzz about so-called "static" websites. In this post we'll tell you what they are, what's the big deal, and what you need to know to build one.

item.title: "Transforming your Documentation Process" panel discussion
item.description: A panel discussion about companies transforming their documentation process at the 2016 Write the Docs conference

item.title: Why Marketers Need to Learn Wireframing
HTML and CSS: Still Relevant for Designers
item.description: Knowing only HTML and CSS will still get you far as a designer, and can give you all the qualifications you need to meet the new bar for designers.

item.title: Soft Skills for UX Designers
item.description: These practicable skills can be invaluable in getting your ideas and hard work into the end product.

item.title: Tips for Presenting Your Wireframes
item.description: Once you’re done with your wireframes, you’ll need to present them to get someone’s approval. Learn 3 effective strategies to get buy-in and move forward.

item.title: 3 Steps to Better UI Wireframes
item.description: If you're new to wireframing, or are looking to level up your wireframe game, these steps should help you get the most out of the wireframing stage.

item.title: On Working from Home, Better
item.description: Reflections on my first three years of working fully remote. In order to succeed I had to forget what I thought that working looked like.

item.title: Nigalya Ponya
item.description: Himalayan red panda

item.title: Forget your Dream Job
item.description: I finally landed mine. And I was miserable.

item.title: The User Experience Gap
item.description: Every once in a while I’m reminded that there are still plenty of products out there that are in need of some serious UX love.

item.title: Tales from a UX Guerrilla
item.description: After several failed attempts, I found a way to bring UX to the table on a development-led project team.

item.title: Using Wireframes with Agile User Stories
item.description: A step-by-step guide on how to use wireframes in your Agile User Stories. Tips: add just enough detail and focus on what developers really need to know.
